title: Chapter 1: Limits and Continuity
content:
Key Concepts:

  • Definition of a limit
  • Properties of limits
  • Continuity at a point

Important theorem: If f(x) is continuous at x = a, then lim(x→a) f(x) = f(a)

Practice problems: 1.1 #5-15, 1.2 #8-20

title: Derivatives - Chain Rule
content:
The chain rule is fundamental for composite functions:

Formula: If y = f(g(x)), then dy/dx = f'(g(x)) × g'(x)

  • Step 1: Identify the outer and inner functions
  • Step 2: Find derivatives of both
  • Step 3: Apply the chain rule formula

Common mistakes to avoid:

  • Forgetting to multiply by the inner derivative
  • Incorrectly identifying composite functions

title: Newton's Laws of Motion
content:
First Law (Inertia):

An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion at constant velocity, unless acted upon by an external force.

Second Law:

F = ma (Force equals mass times acceleration)

  1. Force is measured in Newtons (N)
  2. Mass in kilograms (kg)
  3. Acceleration in m/s²

Third Law:

For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

title: Victorian Literature Themes
content:
Major themes in Victorian literature:

  • Social class and inequality - Reflected industrial revolution impacts
  • Morality and religion - Conflict between faith and science
  • Gender roles - Women's changing position in society
  • Empire and colonialism - Britain's global influence

Key authors to remember:

  1. Charles Dickens - Social reform novels
  2. Charlotte Brontë - Women's independence
  3. George Eliot - Psychological realism

title: Data Structures: Binary Trees
content:
Binary Tree Properties:

  • Each node has at most 2 children
  • Left child < Parent < Right child (in BST)
  • Height determines search complexity

Tree Traversal Methods:

  1. Inorder: Left → Root → Right
  2. Preorder: Root → Left → Right
  3. Postorder: Left → Right → Root

Time Complexity:

  • Search: O(log n) average, O(n) worst
  • Insert: O(log n) average, O(n) worst
  • Delete: O(log n) average, O(n) worst
